com.objetdirect.tatami.client.grid
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.objetdirect.tatami.client.AbstractDojo
              com.objetdirect.tatami.client.grid.Grid
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, DatumChangeListener, FetchListener, HasAdaptiveSize, HasDojo
public class Grid
extends AbstractDojo
implements FetchListener, DatumChangeListener, HasAdaptiveSize

This class is a simple wrapper around Dojo Grid. It relies on an underlying GridDataStore, and uses a GridLayout to define its appearance

Author:
rdunklau

addRow

public void addRow(java.lang.Object[] row,
                   int index)
Parameters:
row - : an array of Object containing the various columns content (in order) A mapping is automatically performed between the Object array and the fieldnames used by the colums An id is generated if the id is not one of the shown columns. Then , it inserts the constructed item in the underlying data store
index - : the index where the row should be inserted

createDojoWidget

public void createDojoWidget()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: HasDojo
Creates the widget Dojo using JSNI for the most of the cases. This method is not to be executed directly in your widget GWT, a controller has to execute it.

Specified by:
createDojoWidget in interface HasDojo
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the dojo widget can't be created. Warning, check the parameters and their type of JavaScript objects when JSNI is used. A JavaScript error can cause a fatal failure for the module.

getDojoName

public java.lang.String getDojoName()
Description copied from interface: HasDojo
Returns the name of the dojo widget example : FisheyeList This method is used to load the scripts JavaScript for Dojo and create the dojo widget. See the Dojo documentation to know the good name.

Specified by:
getDojoName in interface HasDojo
Returns:
the name of dojo widget

onBegin

public void onBegin(FetchEventSource source,
                    int size,
                    Request request)
Description copied from interface: FetchListener
Called at the beginning of the fetch process

Specified by:
onBegin in interface FetchListener
size - : total expected number of item, which does not necessary equals the total number of item fetched. Usually, it should be the maximum amount of item that could have been fetched (for example, if the request "maxNbItemToReturn" didn't limit it).
request - : request used during the fetch process

getRowsPerPage

public int getRowsPerPage()
Returns:
the number of rows per page in Tatami's pagination system

setRowsPerPage

public void setRowsPerPage(int rowsPerPage)
Sets the number of rows per page.

Parameters:
rowsPerPage - : the number of rows per page. A value of -1 indicates that all rows should fit on a single page. That does not mean they are all loaded at one time, since only the displayed rows are loaded, and updated when the user scrolls. Default : -1

whichElasticView

public int whichElasticView()
Returns:
the view index corresponding to the "elastic" view. The elastic view is the one which width is adapted to fit the remaining space

setElasticView

public void setElasticView(int elasticViewIndex)
Parameters:
elasticViewIndex - : the index of the view that should be elastic The elastic view is the one which width is adapted to fit the remaining space

getMaximumFetchCountAtAtime

public int getMaximumFetchCountAtAtime()
Returns:
: the maximum number of item that should be fetched at a time. This is used by dojo during its "sroll paging"

setMaximumFetchCountAtAtime

public void setMaximumFetchCountAtAtime(int maximumFetchCountAtAtime)
Sets the maximum number that are returned at a time. It indicates how many items should be loaded. When the user scrolls, items to be displayed are fetched by groups of maximumFetchCountAtAtime items. A typical setting for this value is 1.5 the number of rows to be displayed at a time. (That is , the grid won't have to load items until the user scrolls)

Parameters:
maximumFetchCountAtAtime -

public void removeSelectedRows()
Remove currently selected rows
